isis.stitle: ELECTRONIC ENGINE CONTROLS - CUMMINS CELECT - 1992 - 1993 - TROUBLESHOOTING

svcsubsecinfo.para: This section includes troubleshooting charts for International installed circuits and components, that are part of the CELECT Electronic Control system. To begin the troubleshooting process refer to the appropriate Cummins manual (refer to paragraph Description for information to get Cummins manuals) and follow their directions. If the Cummins diagnostics (fault codes) indicate that the suspect circuits are International circuits or components, then use the charts in this section.
The Pro-Link DDR can also be used to determine if the International switches and components are working properly. If they are not, use a Fluke digital multimeter (DMM) to trouble shoot the circuits.
If the CELECT diagnostic codes or the Pro-Link indicate a problem with the following circuits, the flow charts provide a step-by-step test procedures.

svcproc.title: INSPECTING INTERNATIONAL ENGINE HARNESS ECM CONNECTOR (C320)

step1.para: Remove connector (C320) from the ECM, first removing the two capscrews. Carefully pull the connector straight out of the ECM. The connector pins are numbered ( Figure 5.01) and correspond to the numbers on the circuit diagrams (located in this section).
Inspect the connector for pushed back or expanded terminals in the following manner:

step2.para: Insert the tool (Cummins part number 3823383) into each Amp connector ( Figure 5.02). Do not force the tool into the connector.
A terminal that is not pushed back or expanded will have a surface to tool gap ( Figure 5.03) of approximately 0.050 inches (1.3 mm). If the tool touches the connector, replace the terminal.

Push the tool into the terminal until the tool touches the connector ( Figure 5.04). Slowly remove the tool from the terminal. A small resistance (6 to 10 ounces) must be felt. If the resistance is not felt, the terminal is expanded and must be replaced.
Repeat steps A through C to check for pushed back or expanded terminals for all terminals in the ECM connector.
Inspect the connector pins in the ECM. If the pins are bent ( Figure 5.05), have a Cummins dealer replace the ECM.

figure.caption: Figure 5.03 - Inspecting For Pushed Back Terminals
